title: Spanish training center prepares volunteers to fight in Ukraine
description: The Catalan-based GOA Tactical offers courses that test candidates' abilities to occupy enemy trenches and withstand highly stressful situations. Experts scrutinize the center's lack of transparency and legality.

title: Volkswagen faces production standstill due to IT issues
description: Setbacks compound for the German car giant who earlier this month said it was cutting 269 temporary jobs at its flagship electric car plant in Zwickau and is facing tough competition in the electric vehicle sector.

title: War in Ukraine: Recently delivered American Abrams tanks won't win the war on their own
description: The first tanks promised by Washington have arrived, months ahead of schedule. The Kremlin has said they 'will burn' and that their arrival on the battlefield 'will not change the balance of power.'

title: Central Greece hit by second flood in weeks
description: Greece has been promised emergency funding from the European Union and is renegotiating details of existing aid packages to target more funds to cope with the damage caused by wildfires and floods.

title: Rock star Bruce Springsteen postpones 2023 tour dates
description: The musician is recovering from treatment for peptic ulcer disease.

title: Namibia wait for Rugby World Cup win goes on
description: Fullback Baltazar Amaya scored two tries as Uruguay overturned a halftime deficit to defeat ill-disciplined Namibia 36-26 for a bonus-point victory on Wednesday.

title: How Niger's junta won its face-off with France
description: After two months of face-to-face confrontation with the ruling military in Niamey, the French President was forced to announce the withdrawal of his soldiers and the recall of his ambassador, in a turning point for the Sahel region.

title: Argentina searches sound model to make best of lithium
description: The country wants to benefit from rising global demand but struggles to define a clear strategy. Indigenous populations are concerned about the environmental and social impact of mineral extraction.

title: New French report warns that 'serious violations of human dignity' in porn is commonplace
description: Online pornography is abundantly filled with shocking and degrading scenes that could be punishable by law, according to a new report. The council behind the report wants the porn industry to be sanctioned.

title: In English-speaking parts of Cameroon, rape used as weapon of war
description: The army has been fighting separatists in the NorthWest and SouthWest regions since 2017. Over 6,000 died, more than 700,000 have been displaced, and dozens of women were raped.

title: Anti-pollution standards: EU member states defer to auto industry arguments
description: Opposing the EU Council, member countries have ruled out a further tightening of anti-pollution standards, arguing that it could slow down manufacturers' investment in electric vehicles.

title: Azerbaijan arrests former Karabakh leader amid mass exodus
description: Ruben Vardanyan, a businessman who headed the separatist government from November 2022 until February, was among thousands trying to leave the enclave for Armenia.

title: Germany bans far-right neo-Nazi group
description: The 'cult-like, deeply racist' Artgemeinschaft network was accused of trying to spread Nazi ideology to children.

title: 'DogMan': The revenge of an anti-hero saved by canine love
description: Luc Besson takes up the theme of damaged childhood in a paroxysmal film peppered with incongruous interludes.

title: India's elite schools see a wave of suicides among Dalit students
description: Since January, 7 Dalit students have died of suicide. It has reawakened the debate around institutionalized discrimination in India's most selective and prestigious universities.

title: North Korea expels US soldier who entered the country in July
description: North Korea originally claimed Travis King defected there after being disillusioned with the inequality of American society and racial discrimination in its army.

title: The Freedom Caucus: US Republican lawmakers push the federal government to the brink of shutdown
description: Washington is on the brink of another federal shutdown, in a crisis that is both incomprehensible and predictable, given the balance of power within the Grand Old Party, where radicals have seized the upper hand.

title: The UK's second city Birmingham is bankrupt
description: Since the success of the Commonwealth Games it hosted in 2022, one of Britain's former industrial cities has sunk into crisis. Poor management is one of the reasons for its downfall. The local government is due to present a rescue plan.

title: Israel's far right criticizes UNESCO classification of Jericho archaeological site
description: The inclusion of Tell es-Sultan, in the occupied West Bank, on the World Heritage List was approved at a UNESCO meeting in Saudi Arabia.

title: Ukrainian soldiers trained abroad express discontent: 'I repeatedly told them NATO manuals didn't apply'
description: Some Ukrainian soldiers sent to learn modern combat techniques in the UK, Spain, Germany or Poland are now feeling disappointed. When faced with an emergency, they sometimes find more help... on YouTube.

title: UK interior minister Braverman questions role of UN refugee convention
description: UK minister Suella Braverman asked in a speech in the United States on Tuesday whether the UN Refugee Convention was 'fit' for the 'modern age'.

title: Xi Jinping confronts his own hiring errors in the Chinese army
description: The recent disappearance of Defense Minister Li Shangfu and the sidelining of missile force generals raise questions about the absolute nature of the Chinese president's control over the armed forces.

title: India resumes internet ban in restive Manipur after fresh protests erupt
description: The recent protests followed the publication of photos of two dead students who went missing in July. Over 150 people have been killed in Manipur since armed clashes broke out in May 2023.

title: Ukraine wants to thwart Moscow's plans all the way to Africa
description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky's meeting with Sudan junta leader General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, in Ireland on September 23, shows Kyiv's involvement in the country's civil war.

title: Police double stabbing trial: The day terror followed French officers into their home
description: On June 13, 2016, a policeman and his partner were murdered in their home in front of their 3-year-old son. The terrorist, Larossi Abballa, was killed during the subsequent police raid. On Monday, one of his friends, Mohamed Lamine Aberouz, went on trial as an accomplice.

title: In Canada, Kenneth Law, the postal serial killer
description: Since 2021, the 57-year-old Canadian has allegedly sold online and mailed potentially lethal powder sodium nitrite to thousands of people considering committing suicide. He will appear before the Ontario Court of Justice on Wednesday.

title: Corsican elected officials await Macron's message on the island's status
description: The French president is due to visit the Mediterranean island from September 27 to 29 at a time of uncertainty that local politicians have described as a tipping point between compromise and renewed tension.

title: At least 114 dead and 150 injured in a fire during a wedding in northern Iraq
description: There is no official cause of the blaze but initial reports by Kurdish television suggested fireworks at the venue may have sparked the fire.

title: In Tokyo, the menace of a 'Big One' with unimaginable effects
description: While commemorating the centenary of the Kanto earthquake, which killed more than 100,000, the Japanese capital and its region stand a 70% chance, according to official estimates, of being struck again by a powerful earthquake in the next 25 to 30 years.

title: French scientists are 'Calling for the implementation of a Manhattan Project for environmental transition'
description: A group, including Nobel Prize-winning physicist Alain Aspect and biologist Eric Karsenti, argue for the creation of a research center linked to the industry sector, similar to the American investment to develop the first atomic bomb.
